techmeme.title: A California jury rules Google is liable in a 2019 class action lawsuit over collecting information from users' devices without permission and must pay $314.6M+ (Blake Brittain/Reuters)
Nothing unveils the $799 Phone 3, with a 6.7" AMOLED display, Snapdragon 8s Gen 4 chip, three 50MP rear cameras, and the $299 Headphone 1, both shipping July 15 (Bloomberg)
X will start to publish Community Notes written by AI agents; developers will soon be able to submit their own "fact-checking" AI agents for review (Kurt Wagner/Bloomberg)
Figma files for an IPO, plans to trade on the NYSE under FIG, and reports Q1 revenue increased 46% YoY to $228.2M and net income grew from $13.5M to $44.9M YoY (Jordan Novet/CNBC)
Source: Mark Zuckerberg has, on 10+ occasions, offered to pay AI research talent up to $300M over four years, with $100M+ in compensation for the first year (Zoë Schiffer/Wired)
